Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394543) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394543)
